original: HALLBERG, Uno Leontius, Disponent, Örebro, f Mörtfors, Misterhult, Kmr l, 18/6 94, gm Gerda Johnsson. Eft slut skolstud anst h öl föret i kolonialv.bransch. Disp f AB Hallsbergs Bröd, Hallsberg, 26, f Örebro Ångbageri öbr sed. 32. Styr.led Frn Sv Spisbrödsfabrik 30—36. W6.0 HALLDIN, Carl-Hjalmar, Civilingenjör, Stockholm, f Kall, Jämtl, 15/4 76 av sågv.disp Th H o Hilda Rosenvinge, gm (2) red Elisabeth Krey-Lange. Östersunds hal, CTL (maskinbyggn o mek tekn) 95—99, spec.stud i kemi o eltekn. Ing v Brusafors sulfitfabr 0 Hällefors pappersbr 99—01, v "Villacher Cel-lulosefabr Villach Österr 02—03, disp.ass v Alby kloratfabr 03—06, manager v North Western Cyanamide Co Ltd London o Ödda Norge 06—10, l:e ing v Ljunga verk 10—12, manager v Hydro Electric Power & Metallurgical Co Ltd Melbourne Austr 12—21, driftsch v prof Mahns försöksfabr Berlin-Karlshorst 21—25, konsult ing f fman Carlo Agosto & Co Genua Ital 25, nu avd.ch h Arb.giv :s oms Olycksf.-försäkr.bol. Har uppfört fabr.byggn i Norge, Tyskl, Ital o Austr. Led Sv Tekn.frn.
translated:
HALLBERG, Uno Leontius, Manager, Örebro, born in Mörtfors, Misterhult, Kamrat (Comrade) l, June 18, 1894, married to Gerda Johnsson. After completing school, he worked for a company in the colonial trade sector. Manager of AB Hallsbergs Bröd, Hallsberg, since 1926, previously worked at Örebro Ångbageri from 1932. Board member of the Swedish Spisbrödsfabrik from 1930 to 1936. [Note: "W6.0" is unclear and may refer to a title or role.]

HALLDIN, Carl-Hjalmar, Civil Engineer, Stockholm, born in Kall, Jämtland, April 15, 1876, son of sawmill manager Th H and Hilda Rosenvinge, married (2) to Elisabeth Krey-Lange. Studies at Östersunds hal (technical college for machine building and mechanical technology) from 1895 to 1899, specialized studies in chemistry and electrical engineering. Engineer at Brusafors sulfitfabr and Hällefors paper mill from 1899 to 1901, at "Villacher Cellulosefabr" in Villach, Austria from 1902 to 1903, assistant manager at Alby kloratfabr from 1903 to 1906, manager at North Western Cyanamide Co Ltd in London and Ödda, Norway from 1906 to 1910, first engineer at Ljunga works from 1910 to 1912, manager at Hydro Electric Power & Metallurgical Co Ltd in Melbourne, Australia from 1912 to 1921, superintendent of Prof. Mahns' experimental factory in Berlin-Karlshorst from 1921 to 1925, consulting engineer for the firm Carlo Agosto & Co in Genoa, Italy from 1925, currently department head at Arb.giv:s oms Olycksf.-försäkr.bol (Employer's Accident Insurance Company). Has constructed factory buildings in Norway, Germany, Italy, and Australia. Member of the Swedish Technical Society since [unspecified year].

career.workplace: Hydro Electric Power & Metallurgical Co Ltd
